name: Electric Highways
description: Electric Highways is an experience/adventure game, inspired by early 3D games and 80's synth pop music. The setting takes place in a surreal, virtual world, made out of abstract graphics, where the player must explore ten levels, each with an individual theme.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP or Higher Processor: Intel Core i3 1.3 GHz Memory: 4 GB RAM Storage: 50 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Do you like Doom era graphics? Do you like a incomprehensible story. Do you like minimalist electro music? Do you like taking acid?  Then this game is for you.   Combine Doom, Tron, Aphex Twin and some acid and that's basically what you have here. Interesting play through, worth the halfhour playtime.

Well worth the $0.00 USD I spent on this game, although lacking in actual gameplay, it is excellent at building atmosphere and made me crave to actually live in a few of the worlds in this game, at least just to explore them.  Well done devs.

this is what i got from it   reaction when I see it   ok this is a free game lets go  after I get to level 'walk in the park' my reaction  wtf is my life  good game so get it and it questions you a bit as well

This game... I don't even know where to begin. The art was amazing and the gameplay is spectacular! this is an amazzing example of a puzzle game, although not traditional. I highly reccomend this game.

Just finished this game and am sitting here now and theres only one thing I can mutter. Wow. This game is a masterpiece. It has a lot of charm and for it's artstyle it's quite the immersive experience. The makers played around a lot with shadows of the eduke32 engine, so in many maps i just found myself astonished. Also, the synthwave music and all the other soundeffects just fit this story to a T. Great work, i definitly recommend this.  Short notice to the authors: Keep up the good work!

Well, it's basically a walking simulator with puzzles, easy ones, but the game has its charms. I really liked the design. Every level is different and atmospheric. The soundtrack is also great. Moreover, the game is free. To be honest, I even thought that this game worth paying for. At least, it's possible to buy its soundtrack XD Be careful, however, because it does feel like an acid trip when you're playing it. I believe that's a good thing because of mental borders breaking and something like that, but it does make your head spin, literally.
Gets a little boring after 20 minutes but the story is really interesting. If you're bored and have an hour to spare, play this game.
hey guys nice game really enjoyed it the sewery area kept me on my toes and really loved every level with its different art style
If u want a game thts like......What the ♥♥♥♥ but also adventure thn get this game  colors 12/10 would
this game sucks 10\10 mlg

I just wanted to say that I am really enjoying this. The author has done an excellent job of capturing the early 3D style in both gameplay and music. As someone who has loved video games ever since Pong, I stll love the older, cleaner 3D worlds in games like Red Faction, Heretic and so on. I am only up to the 4th world, or so but I'm looking forward to more. I got this game for free, but would easily pay for it.  Things that I especially like:  - Clean, 'realistic' 3D world where everything you can see is an object in the world. Vastly superior to jaggy 'pixel art' junk that is so popular now. I know the design is fantastical. By 'realistic' I just mean that the world's and your behaviour are as though it were real.  - Creative puzzles with old school clues in the environment. Puzzles are challenging and fun too.  - Creative use of textures and environments for world elements, wall textures, lighting and so on.  - Intro story, art and music make this feel like an 80's game that somehow I just missed playing.  Thank you to the devs for making such a cool game!  PS: I am also buying the soundtrack.

I cant follow the story and my computer was having trouble until i adjusted the resolution. But, the music takes me back to the days of doom and I just really got stuck on a couple levels until I noticed an obvious solution... overall an intriguing game to try out. I mean its free isnt it?
10/10 don't know what I am playing again
This game was amazing omg!
10/10 Good gaming :D would recommend people to play it
This game... Is confusing and interesting at the same time... It is really good though!
Weird af, but nice af.
This game is a really interesting game,you shuld play it if you like 80's like games.

A simple and fun exploration game. Each level has its own unique atmosphere/aesthetic, and none of them last long enough for you to get bored of them. It took me about 80 minutes to complete, but I was taking my time exploring all the little side-areas and finding all the 'neon lights' - I suspect it could be completed in under an hour. It also had surprisingly little backtracking for a game so centered around navigating through maze areas, which was a relief. Some of the later sections got a few laughs out of me as well.  All in all, a great little game for passing the time on a lazy day. Plus it's free!
Super cool free game! A nice memeory game, logic, parcour and more!!!

Very unique, trippy game and gives off a sort of creepy vibe at times. It's very easy to beat, and the one downside is the short play time, but the amazingly strange atmosphere is definitely worth checking out, especially since it's free to play. I also enjoyed the side-quest for an added gem near the end.
what
Another game in which you're waiting for something to happen, yet nothing happens. Also it's very 'artsy' (which means you don't understand anything going on). Pretty much a waste of time.

Alright, didn't actually get past the first level on this, so thats one point worth looking at. The level design was confusing with no clear objective to get to the end of the level.  The music was alright, being chiptune and ambient. Not the best of mixes. Seeing as this game was completely free, one could excuse it's lack of quality.  Gonna give this game a 4/10 for a attempted good idea, but not pulled off well.
This game lags for a sec and teleports you to where you are at.

I have no clue what was going on. Some kind of timer that didn't actually show up on screen? I mean I don't mind 'bad graphics' (Like it stated) but I felt the first area did not look like the screenshots. It was not colorful and looked boring. :/ I simply couldn't be bothered to finish the game which is a shame. Even though this is not a game you look at reviews before downloading I can't recommend it. Once again it is a free game why the hell are you looking at the reviews just play it...

A bit confusing, not a horror. But if you like Trippy themed games, I suggest this game.
This game is pretty great. I love the scary feel it gave in some of the levels and the happiness and joy it gave in others. i definately reccomend this to whoever is looking for some retro fun!
This game is wonderful   F E A R   Download it for free, and have a cool experience.
Great game, I don't say this about games that often so this game is really good. It started weird at first but then it started getting creepy at 13 min. I really enjoyed this game

Little piece of artwork. If you have an hour of free time, give it a try.  It's just a simple walking game with easy objective to complete on each of the leves. You just walk around to find a key that is unlocking level-ending doors. Each level provides diffrent audiovisual experience. There is marketplaza to explore, spooky underground passages, space station and few more.  Story is interesting, gameplay is smooth and leves are well planned. Time well spent.

Worth the price of admission. Completed in about half an hour, which is what the game pretty much explicitly demands from the beginning. Graphics will take you back to the Dark Forces/Quake/Duke3D age where assets that are not environmental geometry are 2D sprites that constantly rotate to face you. Visuals are original and feel well-loved and handcrafted, if not basic. It's charming and never stands in the way of the overall experience, which is basically a modern retalling of the LSD scenario. You are constantly shifting between psychadelic worlds which while they look and sound very different, all play by practically the same rules. Existential flavor text permeates the game, and is arguably faux-philosophical nonsense, but is inoffensive and never patronizing. It's as if the developer actually wants to leave the question open as to whether or not any of the 'message' of the game is to be perceived as sincere or a parody of its genre.  All in all, throw in the half hour to see the developer's vision. Or not. I don't think they'll mind either way.
very nice game, good music, confusing light, much wow
I didn't know what to expect going into this but, as far as experiences go, this isn't a bad one.

I'm so glad it ended. Everything was nice and the ambiance was nice,until things started to freak me out and paranoia started to get to me. My experience was horrible, but I liked it because I was scared all the time.
Wow... This game is confusing, and at some parts SCARY...
I like it It's a very nice puzzle out of 10 I'd rate it 10/10

Electric Highways is a surreal journey game about a person shutting down a simulator. Each level is completley different from the last but they all have the same goal. You have to find a glyph to match the door to enter the next level. Each level is accompanied by music, again, different each level. I beat the game in a little less than an hour, but I enjoyed every minute. Well... not the five minutes I wasted in the time wasting chamber...  This is a good example of a free game on Steam. No microtransactions, short, sweet. You could support the devs by buying the soundtrack for the game.
Gave me goosebumps every single level
Now that was a cool game. The geometric techno style and great maze design left me pretty content with clicking the download button. This game deserves an award.
all i know of the password at the end is that #4 is the blue orb

The game is a very interesting experience, however is so epileptic prone that I have a hard time reccomending it. Besides that, it's a visual and audio pleasure. It's a walking simulator so take that as you may.
Creepy vibe, but I loved it! Very well made, well worth my time. You can either speed run the game or take your time with each level and go so far as to figure out the story behind the game...
Kinda creepy in under ground level but PLEASE UPDATE!!! This game is amazing though

This game feels very, very unfinished. It feels like it thinks it's saying something important but... isn't. and some of the visual designs give me a headache.  That said, it was engaging enough to play all the way through, and many of the levels have real potential. The paper house, the machine world with all the portals, and the park in particular feel like with a couple more puzzles in there they could be really, really great, and I definitely enjoyed exploring them. It's easy to get caught up in the mood of the environments, and feels a bit like a cut-down hybrid of Portal and Obsidian.
Trippy, and overall a good electro-vibed game.
I enjoyed this litlle mini free puzzle game, I would recommend this game if you've got time on your hands and you'd like to kill it. Overall, I loved the game.

If you love Trippy experiences but don't want to take 1 ton of LSD, Shrooms, Cocaine and some other mental ♥♥♥ drugs... play this game in a dark room (no lights but your computer monitor)... and have a good headset.   Pro's: -Drugs -Trips -Feel good moments   Cons: - seizure
So trippy game! Need to play under shrooms!

This game was very complex and very puzzle like. All the levels you just try and solve the puzzle. I wouldn't recommend it for someone who is under the age of 7 due to the complex puzzles. But over all, this game is amazing.
this is probebly one of the weirdest games i have played but it was still pritty good

wierd but i love it   wazzo-90/100
Don't let the graphics trick you. This is one deep, enjoyable game. Definitely an experience to remember ^_^
this game is electric. this game is a highway. i liked it and there is a soundtrack that plays in the game. i think that you should play this if you can afford it.
i didn`t have anything to do, so i`ve just played it for a bit, and when i realized, i already finished the game `-` but it`s a nice game ;D 30-40 minutes playing it you i'll probably finish it :v

Amazing Visuals!! Engaging atmosphere and audio. Gameplay is an amazing 3D (basically VR-like) point-and-click style adventure. Was a very enjoyable playthrough. I wish there were a bit more of a story to it, which would be very cool. Overall definitely worth the short playthrough. This is a game you will remember.
Really fun, made me think a little too
This is a quick, relaxing, retro game that you can enjoy anywhere, really. It does not require a lot of memory or hardware to play well. Has a nice, quiet, and even spooky vibe to it.
Gameplay Is Simplistic, But Very Interesting And Dynamic. Plus It Only Gets Better And Better The Farther You Get.
Nice game with trippy environment and great background music.
Really interesting Environments ! Dream like, especially the park-scene, can't explain why. Actually found some inspirations for my VR project :) Thx for sharing

This game aims to be an abstract weird sort of experience and let me tell you it does it perfectly. The game can be quite confusing and unrealistic and thats what makes it such a weird but fun experience. I would describe it is very tripy and something to play when you just want to leave reality for a few moments to see and experience a new sort of world. I had fun going back and trying to make sense of it all.

THIS GAME...WOW. SERIOUSLY, THIS WAS SO COOL. There were a lot of levels, the concept was cool, the art for each level was awesome, the soundtrack was cool, the puzzles were challenging but not outragous. I really loved this game.
